ACCOUNTANT
Professional Summary
Emerging accounting professional ready to develop career foundation with expanding operation.
Dedicated to keeping records accurate and controls tight to meet all business needs.
Systematic and well-organized with strong attention to detail, mathematical acumen and GAAP knowledge.

SKILLS

Microsoft Office Account Reconciliation Processes Financial statements Interpersonal, active — listening , and critical thinking skills Proficient in Polish language
Data Entry Superior analytical skills General ledger proficiency Administrative support Customer service

04/2020 to Current
Company Name
— City , State
Prepares necessary adjusting journal entries and period end financial statements.
Executes core financial processes, including vendor setup and payment, operational expenses, administration of bank accounts and account reconciliations.
Processes journal entries and performs accounting corrections to ensure accurate records.
Strengthened financial management processes to bring errors to near-zero in reporting, payroll administration and general bookkeeping.
Prepares governmental reports in compliance with strict standards.
Branch Service Specialist ,

11/2017 to 04/2020
Company Name
— City , State
Provided excellent customer care by responding to requests, assisting with product selection and handling ordering functions.
Managed deposits, withdrawals, transfers and check cashing; verified customer identification, signature and balance information; processes loan payments; and opened/closed accounts.
Ensured compliance with banking policies and audit procedures; maintained and balanced cash drawers on a daily basis.
Overlooked ATM balances, refilled cash as needed and ensured the system is in good working order.
Assessed caller accounts to determine member benefits, identify service needs and resolve issues.
Cashier ,

09/2012 to 06/2017
Company Name
— City , State
Reconciled cash drawer at start and end of each shift, accounting for errors and resolving discrepancies.
Mentored new team members on POS system operation, customer service strategies and sales goals.
Completed sales in excess of $10,000 with near-zero error rate using POS system.
Organized and reported on financial information to document payment histories and assist with sound financial accounting.
Completed tasks quickly and handled multiple responsibilities at the same time.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Private Equity Operating Partner

Location: Los Angeles Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Title: Private Equity Operating Partner
East 57th Street Partners is actively seeking a seasoned Private Equity Operating Partner on behalf of one of our esteemed private equity clients. This pivotal role is designed for a highly experienced executive with a proven track record in driving value creation, operational improvements, and strategic growth within portfolio companies. The Operating Partner will work closely with the private equity team and the leadership of portfolio companies to implement best practices, achieve operational excellence, and execute growth strategies.
Role Summary:The Private Equity Operating Partner will be instrumental in identifying and executing on opportunities for operational improvement and strategic growth across the portfolio. This role requires a blend of strategic vision, operational expertise, and the ability to work effectively with management teams at portfolio companies. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of industry trends, competitive dynamics, and value creation levers that can drive significant returns on investment.
Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with investment teams to conduct due diligence on potential investments, focusing on operational capabilities, growth opportunities, and potential synergies.Develop and implement strategic plans for portfolio companies, including operational improvements, market expansion, and organizational development.Serve as a key advisor to CEOs and management teams of portfolio companies, providing expertise and guidance on business transformation and best practices.Drive performance improvement initiatives across portfolio companies, leveraging data analytics, process reengineering, and technology enhancements.Monitor and evaluate the performance of portfolio companies against operational and financial metrics, identifying areas for improvement.Facilitate knowledge sharing and best practices across the portfolio, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.Support portfolio companies in M&A activities, including due diligence, integration planning, and post-merger integration execution.Contribute to the overall strategy of the private equity firm, including sector focus, investment thesis development, and portfolio construction.Qualifications:Extensive experience in senior executive roles, preferably with a strong background in operational leadership, consulting, or private equity.Proven track record of driving operational improvements, strategic growth, and value creation within complex organizations.Deep understanding of financial analysis, business strategy, and market dynamics.Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with CEOs and management teams.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.Flexibility to travel extensively and work across various industries and geographic locations.Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field; MBA or relevant graduate degree strongly preferred.Benefits:Competitive compensation package, including base salary, performance bonuses, and potential participation in investment profits.Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of professionals in a leading private equity firm.Exposure to a broad range of industries and companies, providing a rich environment for professional growth and development.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.Retirement savings plan with company contribution.Generous vacation and personal leave policies.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
